title: Time-Flight
dialogue_triumphs: That's why this tree/ Doth continue to be / Since observed by yours faithfully, God.
dialogue_disasters: Andrew, I didn't know you had a New York stopover.
goofs: Anthony Ainley seems to mention Chaka Demus and Pliers.
The Doctor incorrectly relates the Jurassic period to the Pleistocene epoch.
A bird flies in front of Concorde when it takes off from Jurassic England.
Heathrow's air traffic control consists of two men in a tiny room.
Angela Clifford disappears halfway through the story.

additional_notes: The story features Concorde crash-landing in Jurassic England, which is considered a questionable plot point.
bottom_line: Somebody, somewhere should have thrown this script in the bin the moment it had Concorde crash-landing in Jurassic England, but, instead, it was made on a typical end-of-season minimal budget. The actors give it their best, but it only exposes the paucity of the concept and the dialogue.
